home.title: üì∑ Real or AI üçå
home.subtitle: Can you tell the difference?
home.soloDescription: Play alone and test your skills
home.withFriendsDescription: Host a game and play with others
home.howToPlayDescription: You'll see 12 images. For each one, decide if it's a real photo or AI-generated. You have 30 seconds per image. Good luck!

q1.question: How does the game work?
q1.answer: You‚Äôll be shown a series of random (pre-generated) images and you must guess whether each one is a real photograph or AI-generated. The website has many photos in its database (700+), so each game will be unique.

q2.question: Where did these photos come from?
q2.answer: On the one hand, the ‚Äòreal‚Äô photos were obtained from Unsplash, using the Unsplash license that allows free use. On the other hand, the AI-generated photos were created using the Nano Bannana Pro model (gemini-3-pro-image-preview).

q3.question: Can I play remotely with friends?
q3.answer: Yes! Choose the ‚ÄòWith Friends‚Äô mode, create a room, and share the QR code or room code with your friends. They can join from any device with a web browser.

q4.question: Who created this and why?
q4.answer: I‚Äôm Pablo (the one who appears at the bottom of each page on this site), I‚Äôm a computer engineering student and I created this project (in approx. 24 hours) to try to raise general public awareness of how hard it currently is to distinguish real images from AI-generated images.

q5.question: Is this website open source?
q5.answer: Yes! The code for this website is available on GitHub, the link is in the header of the page and published under an Apache 2.0 license. You can go take a look if you want to learn how it works under the hood or even contribute.
